thread.title: Actor Randy Quaid, wife released from Vermont jail
thread.title_full: Actor Randy Quaid, wife released from Vermont jail - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Actor Randy Quaid, wife released from Vermont jail
text:
Photo: Elodie Reed, AP Image 1 of / 15   15 Evi Quaid, left, hugs attorney Peter Langrock and she and her husband, actor Randy Quaid, have their handcuffs removed in court Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in St. Albans, Vt. A Vermont judge released the couple, who says they'll now address 5-year-old criminal charges in California. A Vermont judge has released actor Randy Quaid and his wife Evi from custody and the couple says they'll now address 5-year-old criminal charges in California. (Glenn Russell/ The Burlington Free Press via AP, Pool) Evi Quaid appears in Vermont Superior Court in St. Albans, Vt. on Thursday, Oct.15, 2015. A Vermont judge has released Quaid and his wife Evi from custody and the couple says they'll now address ... more Photo: Glenn Russell, AP Image 6 of 15 Actor Randy Quaid arrives at his Immigration and Refugee Board hearing in Montreal, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. Quaid said in an interview that he could be deported from Canada next week and that he would like to resolve his legal issues in California and "move on with my life." The actor and his Canadian wife fled the U.S. in 2010, saying they were victims of persecution.
Actor Randy Quaid arrives at his Immigration and Refugee Board hearing in Montreal, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. Quaid said in an interview that he could be deported from Canada next week and that he would like ... more Photo: Peter McCabe, AP Image 7 of 15 In this Oct. 28, 2010 file photo, actor Randy Quaid arrives for an immigration hearing in Vancouver. Quaid says he could be deported from Canada next week and says he'd like to make movies in the U.S. again. He says he was detained by Canada Border Services on Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015. Immigration and Refugee Board spokesman Robert Gervais confirms the arrest and says Quaid will have a detention review hearing Thursday. In this Oct. 28, 2010 file photo, actor Randy Quaid arrives for an immigration hearing in Vancouver. Quaid says he could be deported from Canada next week and says he'd like to make movies in the U.S. ... more Photo: Jonathan Hayward, AP Image 8 of 15 Chevy Chase starred as Clark Griswold, the wacky father determined to take his family to Walley World. He went on to star in three more 'Vacation' movies and a host of other comedies such as 'Fletch' and 'Three Amigos!' He was a regular cast member on the ABC comedy series 'Community' from 2009 to 2012. In 2012, he and Dan Aykroyd announced they're working on a comedy. (Wikipedia) Chevy Chase starred as Clark Griswold, the wacky father determined to take his family to Walley World. He went on to star in three more 'Vacation' movies and a host of other comedies such as 'Fletch' and ... more Photo: Warner Bros.(L); Larry Busacca (R) Image 9 of 15 Beverly D'Angelo played the ever-patient, long-suffering Ellen Griswold, who puts up with her husband Clark's nutty behavior. She has had roles in over 50 movies and received praise for her performance as Patsy Cline in 'Coal Miner's Daughter' and as Doris Vinyard in 'American History X,' but she's still most widely known for starring in the National Lampoon's 'Vacation' franchise. D'Angelo had twins with Al Pacino; the two were together from 1996 to 2003. (Wikipedia) Beverly D'Angelo played the ever-patient, long-suffering Ellen Griswold, who puts up with her husband Clark's nutty behavior. (L); Paul Archuleta (R) Image 10 of 15 Christie Brinkley made Clark Griswold swoon as she raced by the family station wagon in her red Ferrari. She is best known as a model and continues to appear in magazine photo shoots. She has been married four times, most famously to singer Billy Joel, and in 2008 her divorce with her fourth husband, Peter Cook, was finalized. Christie Brinkley made Clark Griswold swoon as she raced by the family station wagon in her red Ferrari. She is best known as a model and continues to appear in magazine photo shoots. She has been married ... more Photo: Warner Bros. (L); Steven Henry (R) Image 11 of 15 Randy Quaid gets lots of laughs as the loser uncle Eddie who asks Clark Griswold for money and gifts him the famous white loafers in return. Quaid went on to star in many other films including 'Kingpin,' 'Quick Change' and 'Brokeback Mountain.' The infamously eccentric star's film career waned when he started having troubles with the law. Quaid and his wife, Evi, were arrested for defrauding an innkeeper and failing to pay a $10,000 hotel bill in 2010. The couple applied for refugee status in Canada that year, claiming they were possible targets of the so-called 'Hollywood star-whackers' who were supposedly plotting to kill actors. Randy Quaid gets lots of laughs as the loser uncle Eddie who asks Clark Griswold for money and gifts him the famous white loafers in return. While Hall is best known for his teen movie roles as a member of the Brat Pack (think: 'Breakfast Club' and 'Weird Science'), he has gone on to have a full acting career, starring most recently as the lead character in the TV series 'The Dead Zone.' (Wikipedia) Anthony Michael Hall was his dad's pal and a teen heartthrob as Rusty Griswold. While Hall is best known for his teen movie roles as a member of the Brat Pack (think: 'Breakfast Club' and 'Weird Science'), ... more Photo: Warner Bros. (L); David Livingston (R) Image 13 of 15 Dana Barron was always fighting in the backseat with her brother, Rusty, and her role as Audrey Griswold girl was the biggest of her career. She found herself back in the role in 2003's 'Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure' for NBC television. She also had a recurring role as Nikki Witt on the Fox series 'Beverly Hills, 90210' and has made appearances in other TV shows over the years. (Wikipedia) Dana Barron was always fighting in the backseat with her brother, Rusty, and her role as Audrey Griswold girl was the biggest of her career. She found herself back in the role in 2003's 'Christmas Vacation ... more Photo: Warner Bros. (L); Albert Ortega (R) Image 14 of 15 John Candy plays the poor sap who must tell the Griswold family Walley World is closed. Candy went on to have a full film career, acting in movies including 'Spaceballs,' 'Planes, Trains & Automobiles' and 'Uncle Buck,' until dying from a heart attack in 1994. John Candy plays the poor sap who must tell the Griswold family Walley World is closed. Candy went on to have a full film career, acting in movies including 'Spaceballs,' 'Planes, Trains & Automobiles' and ... more Photo: Warner Bros. (L); Harry Langdon (R) Image 15 of 15 Actor Randy Quaid, wife released from Vermont jail 1  /  15 Back to Gallery ST. ALBANS, Vt. (AP) — Released from Vermont custody, actor Randy Quaid and his wife said Thursday they will now turn their attention to resolving 5-year-old criminal charges in California that they squatted in a home they once owned and vandalized the property.
A Vermont judge dismissed fugitive-from-justice charges against the couple and released them, citing discrepancies in some dates and saying she couldn't find probable cause to support the accusations.
The Quaids are wanted in Santa Barbara, California, on felony charges filed in 2010 after they were found living in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. Court papers said the Quaids damaged or destroyed furniture, a fireplace and a mirror. The couple fled to Canada and were arrested in Vermont last Friday while trying to re-enter the U.S.
Related Stories Randy Quaid Looks Like Mountain Man, Arrested Trying to Enter US at Vermont Border Randy Quaid’s wife in prison bust-up Randy Quaid Arrested in Montreal Pending Immigration Hearing: Report After they left the courthouse Thursday, the Quaids said they'll stay in Lincoln, Vermont, to care for Evi Quaid 's ailing father and address the California charges. She grew up in Vermont.
"I never worried about being found guilty or any of that for any of these charges because I know the truth, and I know the facts are going to come out at some point, and today was a good sign of that," Randy Quaid said.
"And we're still going to have to deal with the California situation," the Quaids' lawyer, Peter Langrock , said. "And we plan to, not as a fugitive from justice but the standpoint of a citizen."
The Santa Barbara County District Attorney's office did not immediately respond to a request for comment after the Vermont proceedings.
Outside court, Randy Quaid spoke about his stay in jail. He told reporters he was on a wing with three other men, and they all got along and played a lot of cribbage and Sudoku.
"The food wasn't so bad," he said.
The Quaids said they were pleased to be in Vermont, and he joked about possibly becoming a firefighter.
"I knew the people of Vermont, the judge and this lawyer would understand our situation," said Evi Quaid.
In court, Langrock argued for the couple's release saying that Evi Quaid was threatened by a fellow inmate, who put feces in her cell.
Judge Alison Arms reduced bail for the couple from $500,000 each to $50,000 on a fugitive-from-justice charge that the Quaids failed to appear in court in California. She said she didn't find probable cause to support fugitive-from-justice charges related to the California vandalism and squatting counts.
But after reviewing her decision during a short break, the judge called the Quaids back into court and said she had to release them. She said she could not find probable cause to support any of the charges because of a discrepancy in dates in paperwork from California.
